ref: 3918 *khēḍ ʻ play ʼ. 2. *khēḍḍ -- . 3. *khiḍḍ -- 1. 4. *khīl -- . 5. *khill -- . 6. *khēl -- . 7. *khēll -- . 8. kēl -- or *kēḍ -- . [If krīˊḍati, already in RV. (krīˊḷati, ˚ḷāˊ -- , ˚ḷí -- f., ˚ḷú -- ), is of non -- Aryan origin (see in last instance A. Master BSOAS xii 363 and F. B. J. Kuiper Festschr. A. Debrunner 242: EWA i 279 with earlier lit.), then these forms may stem from the same source. If krīˊḍati is IE., it has crossed with these, e.g. Pk. kiḍḍaï, killaï ~ kīḍaï. Sk. kḗlati ʻ trembles ʼ Dhātup., kḗli<-> f. ʻ amorous play ʼ Mn., khḗlati ʻ shakes ʼ R., khēlāyáti ʻ plays ʼ Bhaṭṭ., khēli -- f. ʻ sport ʼ Gīt. may be connected. kṣvḗlati ʻ jumps, sports ʼ R., kṣvēli -- , ˚ikā -- f. ʻ play ʼ BhP. ac. to EAW i 296 is sanskritization of khēl -- ; but, although there is no form in NIA. with c̣h -- , or ch -- , Gy. eur. and arm. kh -- , pal. k -- (not x -- and ḳ -- < Sk. kh -- ) attest kṣ(v) -- . H. helnā ʻ to play ʼ, if < *abhikhēl -- , separates khēl -- from kṣvēl -- or represents a late cmpd. with MIA. kh -- < kṣ(v) -- ]
